author: Staff Reporter
text:
District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan checking the operations of the Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) system during the training programme held at Thovalai taluk office on Thursday.

Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) system, a method for independent verification of the vote cast by a voter along with the symbol of the candidate of his or her choice, would be introduced on a pilot basis in all the 300 polling booths in Kanyakumari Assembly constituency during the May 16 election, said District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan here on Thursday.

The VVPAT system would be introduced in 17 constituencies in 17 districts of the State during the Assembly polls on a pilot basis.

Inspecting a one-day training programme on the operations of the VVPAT system for Returning Officers, Assistant Returning Officers and Zonal Officers at Boothapandi, Mr. Chavan said that the district administration had received 375 VVPAT units from East Champaran district in Bihar last week.

The VVPAT systems would be linked to the EVMs, and it would enable the voter to check whether the vote was cast in favour of the candidate of his or her choice through a screen where it would be displayed for seven seconds. Then the printed slip would get deposited inside a container linked to the EVM, and it could be accessed by the Election Officers.

Ravi Ranjan, a technical expert from Bharat Electronics Limited, Bengaluru, and Padmanabhapuram Sub-Collector Shreya P. Singh demonstrated its functioning.

District Revenue Officer S. Elango, Kanykumari Returning Officer and District Supply Officer T. Chinnammal, Special Tahsildar (Election) P. Subramanian and others were present.
title: VVPAT system for Kanyakumari
